poem:
### The Uneven Rails

Who knows the land's true need?  
Not those who mark  
the map with steel ambitions,  
nor the masters of expense  
deaf to the quiet plea of soil.  
Progress hums its fractured tune;  
roots are severed, left unsaid  
amongst the fallen leaves,  
as the country watches,  
hard of hearing,  
at the platforms of tomorrow.
